references.paper_title: On discriminative vs. generative classifiers: A comparison of logistic regression and naive bayes
references.reason: This paper lays the groundwork for understanding the fundamental differences and complementary strengths of discriminative and generative models, a central theme in the current research.

references.paper_title: Deep residual learning for image recognition
references.reason: This paper introduces the ResNet architecture, a highly influential model used extensively in image classification tasks and forms the basis of several task models used in the current research.
This foundational paper introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models, which are at the core of the generative models leveraged in the current work for test-time adaptation.

references.paper_title: Tent: Fully test-time adaptation by entropy minimization
references.reason: This paper introduces the Tent method, a key existing technique in test-time adaptation that the current work aims to improve upon using generative models.
This paper addresses the challenge of continual test-time adaptation, a scenario that the current research also tackles and aims to enhance with the proposed method.
